page.title: 05CHANGES IN CHERRY WILLINGHAM
page.content: Cherry Willingham and Reepham have seen several changes over the past few years (since the map was last revised in 1976). The most important change has occured outside our block but is worth mentioning because it has been the subject of much discussion. This is the discovery of a large reserve of oil. Called the 'Welton Field' it covers the area North and East of our block with a railway sidings and storage area just outside Reepham. There has not been much building in the area in the way of housing- about 80 houses in all-. An estate of about 300 houses is proposed in the centre of the village but so far only one house has been built for one of the local personalities. Cherry Willingham has a new pub which is in the Parade and after only two years it is being extended.
